tossupQ:
PHYSICAL SCIENCE Short Answer If the density of a metal alloy is 5,430 kilograms per cubic 
meter, what is its specific gravity, rounded to the second decimal place?
bonusQ:
PHYSICAL SCIENCE Short Answer An Olympic runner braces himself against a stationary set 
of foot blocks and accelerates with a horizontal magnitude of 2 meters per second squared. How 
many newtons of horizontal force does the runner exert on the blocks to produce this acceleration if 
his mass is 70 kilograms?

tossupQ:
EARTH SCIENCE Multiple Choice Which of the following best explains the relative lack of 
hydrogen in our atmosphere in spite of its abundance in the Universe: 
 
W) most of it is tied up in the water molecule 
X) most of it is consumed in photosynthesis 
Y) most of it escaped into space long ago because of its low mass 
Z) most of it was an unstable isotope that decayed into helium
tossupA:
Y) MOST OF IT ESCAPED INTO SPACE LONG AGO BECAUSE OF ITS LOW 
MASS

Y) Hawaii 
Z) northeastern Japan

tossupQ:
LIFE SCIENCE Multiple Choice Which of the following BEST describes muscle tone: 
 
W) maximum strength of a muscle 
X) length versus width of a muscle 
Y) average energy use or oxygen use of a fully contracted muscle 
Z) amount of tension or contraction of a resting muscle
tossupA: Z) AMOUNT OF TENSION OR CONTRACTION OF A RESTING MUSCLE

tossupQ:
PHYSICAL SCIENCE Multiple Choice Randy was precise in his lab experiment but he was not 
accurate. Which of the following best describes his measurements: 
 
W) his data was close to the true value but not reproducible  
X) his data was close to the true value and reproducible 
Y) his data was not close to the true value but reproducible 
Z) his data was not close to the true value and reproducible
tossupA: Y) HIS DATA WAS NOT CLOSE TO THE TRUE VALUE BUT REPRODUCIBLE

LIFE SCIENCE Multiple Choice Which of the following is a theory of heredity postulated by

FOLLOWING GENERATIONS
